body:
@jcoglan -- it unquestionably "smells bad".  And it is neither your fault nor my fault.  And I will note that nobody is upset here -- this stuff is indeed complicated, and I've caught plenty of cases where members of the core team have inadvertently introduced regressions to prove the value of what effectively are minimal system or integration tests.  And I've had my share of [false positives](https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/7910#issuecomment-9648548) where I have identified non-problem and wasted everybody's time.  On balance, however, this ongoing relationship has been mutually beneficial.

I will suggest, as @jonleighton already has, that if you have identified a new fix which addresses this problem that you are in the best position to write a new test to cover the existing hole in the CI tests.
